result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Liam A. Fuller-Idrizi

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on December 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
SEH for 10/31/22 adjourned to 12/15/22 at 8:30 am on court's motion; court unavailable on previously scheduled date.  Confirming email sent to parties.

10:50 AM    Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Liam Fuller-Idrizi, appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Benjamin Schwarz.  Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: 21CF1584/22CF687/22CF766.   Victim rights compliance. Matter is resolved and plea questionnaire filed in court.

21CF1584:  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court. On State's motion counts 2-3 are dismissed and read in.

22CF687:  Defendant entered a plea of guilty to counts 2-3; found guilty by the court. On State's motion count 1 is dismissed & count 4 is dismissed and read in.

22CF766:   Defendant entered a plea of guilty to count 1; found guilty by the court. On State's motion count 2 is dismissed and read in.

Presentence Investigation ordered. Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant, Liam A. Fuller-Idrizi, appeared with Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz.  Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 28, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:28 PM   Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Benjamin Schwarz.   Clerk JT  Minutes:  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 10:15 am..   Cash bond posted and continued as previously set (see previous bond entry). rb

01:52 PM    Attorney Zachary Brost appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Benjamin Schwarz.   Clerk JT  Minutes: Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.   Bond continued as previoulsy set (see previous bond entry). rb

Attorney Francesco Balistrieri appeared specially for Attorney Benjamin Schwarz. Clerk PU.
